research_metadata.context: Single founder, no co-founder, bootstrapped, $0 salary for 6+ months

solo_vs_cofounders.pivot_success_threshold: 1-2 pivots optimal, >2 pivots = 52% more likely to fail
solo_vs_cofounders.cofounder_conflict_rate: 65% of startups fail due to co-founder conflict
solo_vs_cofounders.solo_founder_survival_advantage: 54% less likely to dissolve vs 3-person teams

burnout_timeline.stage_4_burnout: 6-8 months - physical illness, pessimism, desire to quit

founder_imposter_syndrome.comparison_trap: Endless stream of more successful founders to compare to
founder_imposter_syndrome.social_media_distortion: Everyone celebrates wins, hides 3am panic attacks

work_life_balance.vc_backed_perspective: Reid Hoffman: work-life balance = not committed to winning
work_life_balance.bootstrapped_perspective: Sleep, exercise, eat well or develop stroke in 40s
work_life_balance.impact_on_family: Running company impacts quality of personal life with kids

decision_fatigue.solo_disadvantage: No co-founder to share cognitive load

loneliness_isolation.founder_loneliness: One of the loneliest jobs in the world
loneliness_isolation.social_isolation_risk: Key stressor for mental health issues
loneliness_isolation.emotional_distance: No co-founder to share load or offer perspective

key_person_risk.small_business_discount: Much greater, up to 100% for sole proprietors
key_person_risk.investor_concern: Critical risk for valuation and exit planning

financial_stress.cash_flow_risk: Higher risk for stagnant cash flow

technical_founder_sales_gap.product_first_mistake: 42% of startups fail - built product without market need
technical_founder_sales_gap.organizational_gap: Engineering team management != commercial team management

symptoms: Dopamine rush from building covers warning signs
Skipping meals, poor sleep quality begins
Lack of social interaction, withdrawal begins
deterioration: Can't get up easily in morning

symptoms: Stress is now part of everyday life
Desire to withdraw from all social life

outcome: Long recovery period needed (months to years)

skills_gap_spiral.technical_strength: Can build excellent React Native + NestJS platform
critical_weaknesses: Poor understanding of commercial team management
failure_cascade: Month 4: Attempt marketing, waste money on ineffective ads
Month 6: Watch funded competitors with sales teams acquire users
Month 7: Realize technical skills alone insufficient
Month 8: Give up, convinced market doesn't want product
skills_gap_spiral.reality: 42% of startups fail because they built product without market need, but founder blames sales gap instead

decision_paralysis.root_cause: No co-founder to discuss, validate, challenge decisions
failure_pattern: Month 3: First major mistake becomes apparent
Month 5: Analysis paralysis on critical choices
Month 6: Make hasty decision due to fatigue
Month 7: Major setback from bad decision
Month 8: Lost confidence, unable to make any decisions, give up
decision_paralysis.cognitive_load: Decision fatigue makes later decisions progressively worse quality

crisis_timeline: Month 5: Severe flu, takes 2 weeks to recover
health_crisis_scenario.key_person_risk: 100% of business operations dependent on one person's health

financial_crisis_timeline: Month 5: Savings critically low, revenue insufficient
Month 6: Credit cards maxed, considering loan from family
Month 7: Can't pay rent, must take consulting gig
Month 8: Consulting takes 30hrs/week, platform stagnates, give up

opportunity_cost.emotional_cost: Crushing realization of wasted time and money

stress_on_partner: Constant stress and anxiety at home
No vacation, no breaks, no fun
escalation_pattern: Month 6: Partner emotional, worried about future
Month 7: Ultimatum delivered: 'Get job by Month 8 or we're done'
Month 8: Choose relationship over startup, platform dies
relationship_strain.startup_spouse_reality: Romantic partner along for stressful ride, relationship becomes casualty of startup stress

comparison_triggers: Another founder ships similar feature faster
Y Combinator batch announcement (not in it)
Tech news covering 'hot' startups in space
internal_dialogue: Month 4: 'Maybe I'm not as good as I thought'
Month 5: 'They have real teams, I'm just one person'
Month 6: 'Investors fund them, not me - I must not be good enough'
Month 7: 'I'm a fraud, I don't belong in this space'
Month 8: 'I should quit before I embarrass myself further'
imposter_syndrome_spiral.statistic: 75% of founders experience significant self-doubt, gets WORSE over time
imposter_syndrome_spiral.reality_distortion: Comparing your 10th step to someone's 100th step, social media shows only wins

pivot_fatigue.optimal_pivots: 1-2 pivots raise 2.5x more money, 3.6x better growth
solo_founder_vulnerability: No team to maintain morale through changes
No one to challenge hasty pivots
failure_timeline: Month 1-2: Launch as nightlife discovery app
Month 3: Poor traction, pivot to event booking
Month 4: Event organizers unresponsive, pivot to social planning
Month 5: Users confused, pivot to activity recommendations
Month 6: Completely different product, original users gone
Month 7: New users don't understand value prop
Month 8: Lost all momentum, exhausted from constant rebuilding, give up
pivot_fatigue.resource_depletion: Each pivot consumes time, money, and mental energy with diminishing returns

isolation_sources: No co-founder to share daily struggles
psychological_impact: Month 7: Lost all motivation, no one to encourage
Month 8: Give up, need human connection more than success
loneliness_breakdown.statistic: Social isolation is key stressor for mental health issues in entrepreneurs
loneliness_breakdown.support_network: Smaller networks = higher stress, depression, anxiety

opportunity_cost_realization.alternative_scenario: Job offer: $120,000 salary, benefits, stable hours
emotional_breaking_point: Month 7: Realizes 8 months of brutal work = $0 personal income
Month 7: Job offer arrives: $120K, great team, meaningful work
Month 8: Calculate total cost: $100K+ in lost income and savings
Month 8: Accept job, shut down platform, feeling like complete failure
Reality: Made rational decision, but feels like quitter
opportunity_cost_realization.rational_vs_emotional: Economically rational to take job, emotionally devastating to abandon dream

no_cofounder_safety_net: No one to take over when sick
No one to challenge bad decisions
No one to share emotional burden
No one to maintain morale during setbacks
No ability to divide and conquer tasks
no_team_resilience: Platform dies if founder is incapacitated
All knowledge in one person's head
Investor concern about key person risk
no_financial_buffer: Can't hire help even when desperate
One emergency could wipe out business
no_professional_support: 77% of founders refuse professional mental health help
Solo founders even less likely to seek help
Stigma of admitting struggles as 'strong founder'

convergence_analysis.most_likely_failure_mode: Burnout at Month 6-8 combined with financial pressure
supporting_evidence: Stage 4 burnout typically hits at 6-8 months
Financial runway expires Month 5-6 for most bootstrapped founders
Mental health deterioration makes rational decisions impossible
Solo founders have no support system to prevent spiral
convergence_analysis.secondary_failure_mode: Skills gap (can't do sales/marketing) leading to zero revenue
convergence_analysis.tertiary_failure_mode: Relationship ultimatum forcing choice between startup and partner
convergence_analysis.black_swan_failure: Health crisis at Month 5-6 requiring hospitalization, no backup to maintain platform
